strategy: Replace the fully connected neural network with a convolutional neural network (CNN) architecture tailored to the MountainCarContinuous state space, treating the position and velocity as spatial features. Apply convolutional layers with stride and batch normalization to capture local patterns in state transitions, and use a residual connection to improve gradient flow. Introduce a state-dependent feature embedding that maps continuous state values into a higher-dimensional latent space using learnable basis functions, enabling the agent to generalize better across state regions. Train with PPO using a fixed learning rate and add a momentum-based adaptive learning rate scheduler to stabilize convergence.

"""
Copyright (c) Meta Platforms, Inc. and affiliates.
Adapted from https://github.com/RobertTLange/gymnax-blines and https://github.com/RobertTLange/gymnax
"""
import flax.linen as nn
import gymnax
import jax
import jax.numpy as jnp
from tensorflow_probability.substrates import jax as tfp
def get_model_ready(rng, config):
    """Instantiate a model according to obs shape of environment."""
    # Get number of desired output units
    env, env_params = gymnax.make("MountainCarContinuous-v0")
    model = Model(
        **config.network_config, num_output_units=env.num_actions
    )
    # Initialize the network based on the observation shape
    obs_shape = env.observation_space(env_params).shape
    params = model.init(rng, jnp.zeros(obs_shape), rng=rng)
    return model, params
def default_mlp_init(scale=0.05):
    return nn.initializers.uniform(scale)
# DO NOT CHANGE THE NAME OF THIS CLASS. YOUR EVALUATION WILL FAIL.
class Model(nn.Module):
    """Twin Delayed DDPG (TD3) Policy Model for continuous control."""
    num_output_units: int
    num_hidden_units: int
    num_hidden_layers: int
    prefix_actor: str = "actor"
    prefix_critic: str = "critic"
    min_std: float = 0.1
    model_name: str = "td3"
    @nn.compact
    def __call__(self, x, rng):
        # Actor network
        x_a = nn.relu(
            nn.Dense(
                self.num_hidden_units,
                name=self.prefix_actor + "_fc_1",
                bias_init=default_mlp_init(),
            )(x)
        )
        for i in range(1, self.num_hidden_layers):
            x_a = nn.relu(
                nn.Dense(
                    self.num_hidden_units,
                    name=self.prefix_actor + f"_fc_{i+1}",
                    bias_init=default_mlp_init(),
                )(x_a)
            )
        mu = nn.Dense(
            self.num_output_units,
            name=self.prefix_actor + "_fc_mu",
            bias_init=default_mlp_init(),
        )(x_a)

"""
Copyright (c) Meta Platforms, Inc. and affiliates.
Adapted from https://github.com/RobertTLange/gymnax-blines and https://github.com/RobertTLange/gymnax
"""
import flax.linen as nn
import gymnax
import jax
import jax.numpy as jnp
from tensorflow_probability.substrates import jax as tfp
def get_model_ready(rng, config):
    """Instantiate a model according to obs shape of environment."""
    # Get number of desired output units
    env, env_params = gymnax.make("MountainCarContinuous-v0")
    model = Model(
        **config.network_config, num_output_units=env.num_actions
    )
    # Initialize the network based on the observation shape
    obs_shape = env.observation_space(env_params).shape
    params = model.init(rng, jnp.zeros(obs_shape), rng=rng)
    return model, params
def default_mlp_init(scale=0.05):
    return nn.initializers.uniform(scale)
# DO NOT CHANGE THE NAME OF THIS CLASS. YOUR EVALUATION WILL FAIL.
class Model(nn.Module):
    """CNN-based Policy Model for continuous control."""
    num_output_units: int
    num_hidden_units: int
    num_hidden_layers: int
    prefix_actor: str = "actor"
    prefix_critic: str = "critic"
    min_std: float = 0.05
    model_name: str = "cnn_policy"
    @nn.compact
    def __call__(self, x, rng):
        # Reshape input to 2D for CNN (position and velocity as spatial features)
        batch_size, height, width = x.shape[0], 1, 2
        x = x.reshape((batch_size, height, width))
        
        # Actor network with CNN
        x_a = nn.relu(
            nn.Conv(
                self.num_hidden_units,
                (3, 3),
                name=self.prefix_actor + "_conv_1",
                bias_init=default_mlp_init(),
            )(x)
        )
        x_a = nn.batch_norm(x_a)
        x_a = nn.relu(

                self.num_hidden_units,
                (3, 3),
                name=self.prefix_actor + "_conv_2",
